page.description: The Field Label properties shape the label the appears on a control.

sections.description: Clicking the [...] button next to the Style property opens the 'Style Editor'. This editor has two tabs, a Property tab and a CSS Text tab. You can use the Property to adjust the look and feel of the field label and then see a list of changes made to the CSS by clicking on the CSS tab. Here is an example:

The Style editor lets you easily edit a field label. You can adjust border type, even down to each edge of the border, alter fonts.

section.title: Adding Images to a Field Label
section.description: You can use the Style property to add images to labels as a background.

step.note: You will probably need to adjust the Positioning and size properties in the Style editor to make the image fit
